Fit.rationale: Strong senior product and P&L leadership (CPO/GM, EVP roles) across SaaS, platform, adtech and consumer experiences, plus private-equity operating experience driving efficiency and AI workflows — all highly relevant to Fastly's need for a revenue-focused CPO who can scale product orgs. Clear strengths: product org building, GTM alignment, pricing/monetization, ML/AI, M&A/PMI, P&L ownership and leading large teams (90–140). Gaps: limited explicit evidence of infrastructure/networking/edge/distributed-systems product ownership, security-focused enterprise product sales to technical buyers (DevOps/SRE/CISO), and explicit ownership of Product Marketing, Documentation and Product Operations at scale. With targeted reframing and 1–2 clarifying examples (infrastructure/enterprise sales or technical product launches), candidate is a strong fit.

Gap_Map.JD Requirement/Keyword: 20+ years global product leadership in B2B cloud/platform/infrastructure
Gap_Map.Where/Evidence: Career spans 1996–2024 with senior product roles: Chief Product Officer (Move Inc), EVP Product (Financial Engines), CPO (33Across), plus Operating Executive (Silver Lake).
Gap_Map.Gap handling: rephrase bullets to emphasize platform/SaaS/infrastructure leadership and enterprise product delivery.

Gap_Map.JD Requirement/Keyword: Experience with edge computing, networking, distributed systems
Gap_Map.Where/Evidence: Resume contains platform/SaaS and adtech experience but no explicit distributed systems, networking, or edge product ownership.
Gap_Map.Gap handling: add clarifying Q to candidate; reframe existing platform statements conservatively ("platform product strategy") without fabricating infrastructure claims.

Gap_Map.JD Requirement/Keyword: Selling to technical buyers (DevOps, SRE, CTO, CISO)
Gap_Map.Where/Evidence: Mentions partnering with CPOs/CTOs and overseeing B2B2C/B2B SaaS; no explicit DevOps/SRE/CISO buyer engagement called out.
Gap_Map.Gap handling: ask candidate for examples of technical-buyer engagement; rephrase where truthful to mention CTO/engineering stakeholder alignment.

Gap_Map.JD Requirement/Keyword: Product Marketing, Design, Documentation, Product Operations ownership
Gap_Map.Where/Evidence: Move Inc role led product, UX, editorial, sales and operations; Silver Lake role includes org development; explicit mention of Design, Documentation and Product Ops is limited.
Gap_Map.Gap handling: rephrase existing bullets to call out product marketing/design/product ops responsibilities where accurate; ask clarifying Q about direct ownership of these functions.

Gap_Map.JD Requirement/Keyword: Pricing optimization and product profitability focus
Gap_Map.Where/Evidence: Financial Engines implemented freemium; Move Inc delivered monetization; Silver Lake identified EBITDA gains. Not explicit 'pricing optimization' label.
Gap_Map.Gap handling: reword bullets to include 'pricing' and 'monetization' language where supported; ask for examples of pricing-led initiatives.

Gap_Map.JD Requirement/Keyword: Global multi-product experience and portfolio prioritization
Gap_Map.Where/Evidence: Multiple product lines and large portfolios (YP advertising products, 33Across product lines), but 'global' not explicit.
Gap_Map.Gap handling: reframe to 'multi-product/portfolio' experience; ask candidate to confirm global customer responsibilities if any.

Gap_Map.Where/Evidence: No explicit security or enterprise reliability program ownership called out.
Gap_Map.Gap handling: ask candidate about security or reliability product work; avoid adding claims in resume without confirmation.

Gap_Map.JD Requirement/Keyword: Track record driving product-led growth and in-product expansion
Gap_Map.Where/Evidence: Financial Engines B2B2C growth and conversion increases; Move Inc product-led pivot to consumer experience and monetization; 33Across new product lines contributing to run-rate revenue.
Gap_Map.Gap handling: rephrase to use 'product-led growth', 'in-product adoption/expansion' language for ATS alignment.

Gap_Map.JD Requirement/Keyword: Scale product organization: hiring, developing top talent
Gap_Map.Where/Evidence: Led teams of 140, 90, 60; rebuilt product organizations; drove employee engagement and reduced turnover.
Gap_Map.Gap handling: emphasize org scaling, hiring, and leadership development in CPO-targeted bullets.

Gap_Map.JD Requirement/Keyword: Financial acumen: ROI-driven decisions, capital allocation
Gap_Map.Where/Evidence: Oversaw P&L $30M+, identified EBITDA improvements, drove revenue growth and monetization.
Gap_Map.Gap handling: tighten phrasing to highlight ROI, investment prioritization and disciplined capital allocation.

Questions: Did you directly lead or own any infrastructure, networking, or distributed-systems products (yes/no)? If yes, list product name(s) and brief scope.
What was the largest P&L or ARR number you owned or influenced (provide $ value)?
For the roles where you rebuilt product organizations, how many product managers, designers, and product-ops/marketing leads reported into you (provide counts)?
Do you have direct experience selling technical platform products to DevOps/SRE/CTO-level buyers or supporting those buyer journeys (yes/no)? If yes, give one example and buyer role.
Did you own pricing optimization initiatives (yes/no)? If yes, summarize approach and measurable outcome (no invented metrics).
